sentence.text: To have closed such a gap the niggled gentleman must have swiped the juice from his companions ' lips the moment we passed and kick-started them into a sprint .
Foxbat could swipe satellites from the skies like irritant flies ; take the Russians leap-frogging ahead of the planned space shuttle programme .
There was a big owd fly settled on the smithy door ; and this owd boy took off his hat and was just a-goin' to swipe this fly off the door .
` I told you , she -- " But , before she could finish , he swiped the words out of her mouth with the flat of his hand .
I had no intention of swiping the lot .
They join the Army to get guns , and they 're always in trouble for possessing one illegally or swiping a few rounds of ammunition .
What is the point of only taking what you need and looking after your resources for the future , if they are simply going to be swiped by somebody else ?
Within seconds of house-lights-on , all five set-lists have been swiped .
Someone swiped one of little Alec Davidson 's gym shoes and tossed it ahead to the front of the uneven column .
Whilst his companion 's back was turned , Tuppe swiped one of his sausages and thrust it into his mouth .
But it was too late ; large tears rolled down her cheeks and , no matter how swiftly she swiped them away and pretended they were n't there , they just kept on coming .
Lee 's hid some gunpowder he swiped from under the Arches and I 'm gon na pinch it off him . "
So we 'd wait up all night , follow the delivery van around and survive on the bread and milk we could swipe .
